intro: Anoma cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruit. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. The fruit, which is the primary part used, develops from the flower and contains several oil-rich seeds.
